intro: Cyrtandra pickeringii, commonly known as Pickering's helicon, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant is usually found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and is often adorned with fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
